【募集の背景 / Purpose & Scope】
Downstream Bioprocess Science Lab (DSBP) in Chemical & Biological Technology Labs., Astellas performs process development for biologics such as a monoclonal antibody, process characterization study, and process technology transfer to external and internal manufacturing site. DSBP is also responsible for establishing the appropriate control strategy for IND/BLA submission and maintenance of commercial manufacturing for reliable supply with quality for multiple products.
This position is required to lead Project (PJ) activities and support technology team members, and realize process development/manufacturing of biologics for Early/Late phase PJ.
アステラス製薬 原薬研究所 ダウンストリームバイオプロセス研究室(DSBP)では、モノクローナル抗体をはじめとするバイオ医薬品のプロセス開発、プロセス特性評価(Process Characterization Study)、社内外製造サイトへの製造プロセスの移転業務を行っています。また、DSBPはIND/BLA申請のための適切な管理戦略を策定し、良好な品質管理に基づいて商業生産を維持管理する役割を担っています。
このポジションは、プロジェクト(PJ)や技術チームをリードし、初期/後期開発のバイオ医薬品のプロセス開発ならびに製造を推進することが期待されています。
【職務の内容 / Essential Job Responsibilities】
（雇入れ直後）
＜PJ Lead and Technology Team Lead＞
•	Promote and implement process development of biologics such as a monoclonal antibody and technology transfer to external and internal manufacturing site for Early and Late phase PJs as giving appropriate instruction to the team members.
•	Lead establishment of the appropriate control strategy for IND/BA submission and maintenance of commercial manufacturing for stable supply with quality as a PJ Leader.
•	Take an initiative new innovative technology for bio-purification with internal and external collaborators as giving appropriate instruction to the team members.
•	Participate in early morning and/or midnight meeting with CDMO located in different time zone as a functional representative.
＜PJならびに技術チームのリード＞
•	モノクローナル抗体をはじめとしたバイオ医薬品について、技術チームのメンバーへ適切な指示を行い、初期/後期PJのプロセス開発や社内外製造サイトへの技術移転を推進する。
•	PJリーダーとして、IND/BLA申請に向けた適切な管理戦略の策定や良好な品質管理に基づく商業生産の維持管理に関する活動を主導する。
•	社内外の協働体制を構築し、技術チームメンバーへ適切な指示を行うとともに、バイオ精製に関する革新的な新技術の開発へ積極的に取り組む。
•	研究所あるいは研究室の代表者として、異なるタイムゾーンに所在するCDMOや社内協働メンバーとの早朝/深夜の会議に参加する。
（変更の範囲）
会社内での全ての業務
【就業環境に関する要件 / Specific Physical or Environmental Requirements】
•	This roll requires on-site working.
•	It will be permitted to join early morning/midnight meeting from home.
•	This role may travel to manufacturing site in order to perform person in plant.
•	研究所に出社して業務をすることを基本とします
•	早朝や深夜の会議へは自宅から参加することも可能です
•	製造プロセスを移管するため、製造サイトへ出張する場合があります
【応募要件 / Qualifications】
＜必須 / Required＞
•	Experience of purification process development for biologics such as a monoclonal antibody and technology transfer to external or internal manufacturing site.
•	Knowledge of analytical methods for biologics such a monoclonal antibody
•	Master degree with +8 years in pharma or biotech.
•	Business communication skills in English.
•	Cross-functional collaboration skills.
•	Strong problem-solving capabilities and a proactive, hands-on mindset.
•	モノクローナル抗体をはじめとしたバイオ医薬品の精製プロセス開発および社内外の製造拠点への技術移転の経験
•	モノクローナル抗体をはじめとしたバイオ医薬品の分析法に関する知識
•	修士号ならびに製薬・バイオテクノロジー分野における8年以上の経験
•	英語によるビジネスコミュニケーション能力
•	部門横断的なコラボレーション能力
•	優れた問題解決能力と積極的かつ実践的なマインドセット
＜歓迎 / Preferred＞
•	Experience of process validation and BLA submission or manufacturing operation for bio-product.
•	Knowledge of Antibody-Drug Conjugation, formulation and analytical method development
•	Experience of purification process development and technology transfer for monoclonal antibody and the other modality.
•	Ph.D. degree with +5 years in pharma or biotech
•	Experience of abroad
•	バイオ医薬品のプロセスバリデーション、BLA申請、製造業務の経験
•	抗体薬物複合体(ADC)、製剤、分析法開発に関する知識
•	モノクローナル抗体およびその他のモダリティの精製プロセス開発および技術移転の経験
•	博士号ならびに製薬・バイオテクノロジー分野における5年以上の経験
•	海外での業務経験

General Information
Job Advert Title:

Location:

Division:

Description
【募集の背景 / Purpose & Scope】
Astellas aims to create a robust R&D portfolio utilizing cutting-edge science and technology, and is enhancing its engineered biologics modalities, including multi-specific antibodies and Antibody-Drug Conjugates (ADCs). We are seeking a scientist to advance antibody engineering projects within our global Antibody Engineering group under Biologics Engineering unit in Tsukuba, Japan. This role will spearhead the design and development of next-generation biologics and drive innovative therapeutic programs, leveraging deep expertise in antibody engineering and oncology to advance our oncology pipeline. We welcome applications from individuals who can consistently plan and execute research with innovative ideas and a spirit of challenge, and drive research projects as a member of the global team.
【職務の内容 / Essential Job Responsibilities】
（雇入れ直後）
•Plan, design, develop, and optimize monoclonal antibodies, bispecific/multi-specific antibodies, T-cell engagers, engineered cytokines, ADCs, or multifunctional antibodies under the direction of senior members.
•Work closely with biologics engineering, cancer biology, translational science, AI-ML, and clinical development teams.
•Stay at the forefront of antibody engineering advancements, evaluating and integrating novel technologies to enhance biologics discovery and optimization.
•Present findings to internal stakeholders and at scientific conferences and contribute to publications and patent applications.
（変更の範囲）

•PhD with 1+ years or MS with 3+ years of relevant experience in biological research.
•Knowledge and research experience in monoclonal antibody, bispecific/multi-specific antibodies, T-cell engagers, engineered cytokines, ADCs, or multifunctional antibodies.
•Proficient in in vitro assays such as protein-based affinity binding studies, and/or flow cytometry-based cell assays.
•Experience in antibody purification and developability/physicochemical assessment.
•Desire and ability to work in cross-functional, flexible and team-oriented environment.
•Well-balanced communication skills (active & passive) in own language and in English.
•Communication skills with a solid ability to articulate experimental plans, present research findings in meetings.
•Strong work ethic with a dedicated mindset of proactively identifying and filling gaps.
＜歓迎 / Preferred＞
•Experience of oncology research, with familiarity in tumor-targeting biologics and immunotherapies.
•Related industry experience in antibody/protein engineering/biochemistry and molecular biology.
•Understanding of antibody structure/sequence and developability/function relationship.
•Collaborative mindset to work with global project teams.

title: Supply Chain, Inventory and Intercompany Controller
description_text:
General Information
Job Advert Title:
Supply Chain, Inventory and Intercompany Controller
Location:
Nihonbashi, Tokyo
Division:
Global Business Services
Employment Class:
Permanent
Description
【募集の背景 / Purpose & Scope】
The Inventory and Intercompany Manager is responsible for Supply Chain, Inventory and Intercompany Accounting, including cost allocations and Intellectual Property (IP) holder Accounting.  This position supports the standard costing and intercompany transfer pricing processes with Astellas Tax, IP Holder and Affiliate entities globally to support Tax and transfer pricing compliance.  This position prepares financial footnote and disclosures to support group level reporting to Astellas Pharma Inc. (Japan) parent company and is responsible for all associated controls.
In addition, the role has responsibility for overseeing all aspects of intercompany transactions including ensuring compliance with global accounting standards, identifying, and resolving discrepancies, and coordinating with various departments and stakeholders to continually streamline processes and improve efficiency.
The role oversees the Resource Related Billing (RRB) process globally supported by central resources in the Global General Accounting Team as well as those in the Business Process Outsourcer (BPO).
【職務の内容 / Essential Job Responsibilities】
（雇入れ直後）
Ensure compliance with global accounting standards and regulatory requirements related to intercompany and inventory transactions
Review intercompany transactions, netting and balances, ensuring accuracy and completeness of data, including discrepancy resolution.
Collaborate with various departments and stakeholders to streamline intercompany processes, continuously monitoring and evaluating the effectiveness of intercompany processes, and making recommendations for enhancements.
Maintaining the SAP Cost Objects Structure to ensure costs are properly captured and charged to the responsible IP holding entity
Maintaining and overseeing the execution of inter/intra-company assessment cycles (RRB) and associated invoicing in accordance with intercompany Transfer Pricing Agreements
Ensure that accounting for Project Tomorrow (recharging of senior colleagues) is aligned with global tax policy
Analysing product profitability and gross margin for intercompany transactions (transfer pricing margins, IP holder margins, contract manufacturing, contract revenue) and performing true-up adjustments to align with Transfer Pricing Policy
Supporting Inventory and Supply Chain accounting, VAT reporting, reconciliations, and analysis, including 3PL reconciliations and controls
Performing inventory revaluation as required and accounting for standard to standard and actual to standard variances, such as purchase price variances and stock write offs. Consideration of the effects of Goods in transit on stock levels and IFRS15
Working with internal and external auditors for J-SOX, Controls Reviews, PBC requests and other inquiries as needed
（変更の範囲）
会社内での全ての業務
【就業環境に関する要件 / Specific Physical or Environmental Requirements】
•	This position is based in the Global Capability Centre. Attendance in the office is expected on a hybrid basis of 2-5 days per week to meet business needs and to ensure strong connections are maintained with other Global General Accounting colleagues, whilst the flexibility to work from home will enable colleagues to maintain a healthy work/life balance.
•	International travel maybe required to attend Global Business Solutions Strategic Forums or Workshops.
【応募要件 / Qualifications】
Strong background in Accounting or Finance
-	ACA / or ACCA / or CPA and / or equivalent accounting qualification is preferred
-	English and local language advanced level in speaking and writing
Experience:
-	Minimum 5 years of relevant experience in intercompany and inventory accounting or a similar field
-	Prior experience in a multinational environment and matrix organisation preferred
-	Familiarity with Shared Service or Global Capability Centre collaboration models

Description
【募集の背景 / Purpose & Scope】
The Team Lead of Medical Information (MI) Inquiry-Japan is responsible for direction and strategy, in alignment with the Global MI team, of the Japan Standard Response Development and Escalation Team (Japan MI Team). This team is responsible for developing and maintaining MI content and managing escalations across Astellas products and therapeutic areas in Japan. This role requires strategic leadership in a matrix environment. It ensures the Japan MI Team is integrated into the global MI team’s ways of working and drives MI content innovation and timely, efficient content creation that meets channel/format preferences to provide a seamless customer experience worldwide, including Japan. This leadership role provides direction for customer issue resolution and will serve as the escalation point for critical customer issues that require leadership intervention.
【職務の内容 / Essential Job Responsibilities】
（雇入れ直後）
Strategic Leadership
•	Responsible for ensuring that the Japan MI Team delivers with the highest level of quality, in compliance with evolving regulatory requirements and reflective of most up-to-date scientific knowledge and insights in fair-and-balanced manner
•	Cultivates an innovation and ‘change mindset’ within the Japan MI Team, including ability to deliver and progress when there is ambiguity or uncertainty.
•	Demonstrates strong change leadership skills by translating and transforming challenges into solutions for an improved and successful global team
•	Responsible for monitoring MI performance metrics and other metrics for quantitative or qualitative feedback on MI content and escalation rates/response times
•	Establishes and maintains strong partnership with other MI Team leads and other cross-functional stakeholders to enable optimal functioning of Japan MI Team
•	Fosters matrix collaboration and integrated ways of working between MI Teams and Medical Communications & Engagement Product Teams (MCPTs)
•	Champions a collaborative mindset, ensuring strategic alignment with key matrix stakeholders with regards to business objectives and MI content strategies and deliverables
Medical Information Content Leadership
•	Oversees the creation and execution of local product strategies that align with local brand strategy and ensures MI content meets Japan customer needs
•	Manages a team responsible for creation of high quality, dynamic MI content for consistent and timely utilization across all MI channels (including Contact Centers, Websites/Self-Service Portals), optimizing use of global MI content for global products
•	Drives Japan MI Team to create a variety of content tailored to meet customer needs and channel/format preferences
•	Cultivates, encourages, and enables technologic advancements for content creation through Artificial Intelligence (AI) in collaboration with key stakeholders
•	Effectively develops and drives a systematic approach for the creation, review, approval, and consistent maintenance of MI content in collaboration with key stakeholders
•	Monitors external environment and benchmarking data on HCP/customer content and channel preferences
•	Supports MA capability to orchestrate omni-channel interactions aimed at addressing the informational and educational needs of our customers
•	Identifies and implements process improvements for content generation in collaboration with Global Medical Communication & Engagement Enablement and Medical Affairs Operations
•	Drives innovation and enhancements of MI content in alignment with the evolving needs of our customers (e.g., HCPs, KEE, Payors, policy makers).
•	Drives integrated ways of working across Global Medical Communications & Engagement, including reuse of central content for efficiency, while ensuring ‘one Astellas voice’.
Medical Information Alliance Partner Management for Japan local products
•	Leads and manages alliance partner discussions, driving alignment on strategic goals and performance metrics.
•	Negotiates and establishes joint charter/rules of engagement, ensuring clear communication and shared expectations between the company and alliance partners.
•	Facilitates regular meetings with alliance partners to review progress, address challenges, and drive continuous improvement.
•	Establishes relationships with key stakeholders at partner organizations, ensuring a collaborative and effective working relationship.
•	Resolve conflicts and challenges that arise in the partnership
Customer Issue Resolution Oversight and Management
•	Oversight of Escalation Team’s resolution of customer complaints
•	Provides strategic direction to the escalation team, ensuring necessary resources and training to address customer issues
•	Provides insights on escalated cases and collaborates cross-functionally to identify root cause of customer pain points and works to address underlying issues
•	Serves as the escalation point for critical customer issues that require senior leadership intervention and ensures timely, professional, and effective communication with customers to restore trust and confidence.
•	Establishes and reviews key performance indicators (KPIs) related to customer complaints, escalation outcomes and customer satisfaction. Regularly assess the effectiveness of escalation procedures and ensure continuous improvement in customer service processes.
Medical Governance
•	Ensures Japan MI Team follows MI processes, procedures, and best practices in alignment with Legal / Regulatory / Compliance.
•	Liaise closely with the MI Delivery team to address vendor and affiliate-specific matters related to MI inquiry handling
•	Stays current on latest industry trends to ensure Astellas standards are in line with best practices and implements required and/or innovative changes
•	Stay current on global and local regulations and guidance that impacts interactions with and delivery of MI responses to unsolicited requests from customers
People and Vendor Resource Management
•	Leads a high performing team, which delivers high quality and scientifically sound work across multiple therapeutic areas
•	Oversees resource allocation to ensure MI content generation and inquiry management needs are met
•	Oversees outsourced vendor strategy for medical writing, QC/editing and translation services, ensuring that they meet performance, quality, and timeline standards
•	Manages vendor budgets, ensuring efficient use of internal and outsourced resources
•	Responsible for assessing needs and building capabilities to meet the MI business needs
•	Responsible for managing MI talent (e.g. individual development plans, talent retention)
（変更の範囲）
会社内での全ての業務
【就業環境に関する要件 / Specific Physical or Environmental Requirements】
•	At Astellas we recognize the importance of work/life balance, and we are proud to offer a hybrid working solution allowing time to connect with colleagues at the office with the flexibility to also work from home. We believe this will optimize the most productive work environment for all employees to succeed and deliver. Hybrid work from certain locations may be permitted in accordance with Astellas’ Responsible Flexibility Guidelines.

•	Advanced Healthcare Degree (MD, PhD, MSc, or PharmD)
•	10 years of pharmaceutical industry or related experience, including at least 5 years of Medical Information experience.
•	At least 2 years of personnel management and/or group/team leader experience.
•	Demonstrates a thorough understanding of legal/regulatory/compliance requirements and guidelines with respect to medical affairs and medical communications in the pharmaceutical industry.
•	Responsible for effective strategic thinking and problem solving with a high degree of emotional intelligence, with the ability to both recognize and anticipate problems.
•	Demonstrates understanding of the commercial business within the therapeutic area and associated customer service needs.
•	Demonstrates matrix leadership skills, achieving business objectives through matrix teams, and strong collaborative and problem-solving skills.

•	Demonstrates the ability to review/understand complex scientific and medical data from clinical and non-clinical trials and summarize content in both written and verbal forms.
•	Thorough knowledge of company products and pharmaceutical industry workings.

【募集の背景 / Purpose & Scope】
遺伝毒性の専門性を活かし、多様な医薬品モダリティに関する遺伝毒性と発がんリスクに関する研究および評価を担当し、社内プログラムにおける意思決定に貢献して頂きます。
社内プログラムの円滑な推進に必要な遺伝毒性に関する科学的知見の集約および研究の推進を担当頂きます。
必要に応じて戦略策定に関わり、代表して社内外との横断的なコラボレーションをリードする場合がございます。
Provide scientific and technical support with genotoxic elucidation and strategy building within and across PCUs that includes the design, analysis, assessment and reporting of genotoxicity studies.
Responsible for genotoxicity and risk of carcinogenesis assessment and contribute to decision making in each chapter by leveraging expertise.
Responsible for collecting scientific information/promoting research advocacy necessary for smooth promotion of internal programs. This position may play an assistant role for Sr. managers of Exploratory Pathophysiology (EP) section in NCBMS.
This position may contribute to forming EP group strategy and leading cross functional collaboration with other departments as a representative of EP.

- 社内プログラムにおいて遺伝毒性の専門家として意見を提言します。
- 社内プログラムの円滑な推進に必要な知見を集約し、研究推進を支援します。
- 非臨床研究における標的と医薬品モダリティに関する遺伝毒性の懸念に関する情報を提供します。
- ステークホルダーの協力を得て、新しい評価系を構築および実装します。
-必要に応じて社内の非臨床安全性の意思決定会議に、専門家として参加します。
- INDやNDAに関する申請文書を作成し、規制当局を含む社外ステークホルダーとのやり取りをします。
（雇入れ直後）

- Implement a new evaluation system with the consent of stakeholders

このポジションはつくば御幸が丘となり、オンサイト業務となります。

- 遺伝毒性および関連する規制科学に関する専門知識
- 社内外の組織と、母国語および英語 (望ましい) でコミュニケーションできるスキル
- Master’s Degree- Knowledge of drug development and nonclinical research

- Leading expertise in genotoxicity

Employment Class:

Description
【募集の背景 / Purpose & Scope】
・本ポジションは、本社においてコーポレートファイナンス機能の担当として、中長期的なビジネスプランに基づいた損益計算書（P&L）、貸借対照表、キャッシュフローを統合した分析と管理、財務戦略の策定、最適な資本構造を実現するための取り組み、資金調達戦略の計画を行い、経営層をサポートする。
・また、キャッシュマネジメント（日本円および外国通貨）、外部資金調達（コマーシャルペーパー、銀行融資など）、外国為替管理（分析、取引、処理）、グループファイナンス（インターカンパニーローン、キャッシュプーリング
、ネッティング
決済など）、監査関連業務、トレジャリー業務に関連する文書の手配や社内会議の調整、関連当局への報告などの活動を担当する。
・本役割には、日本の財務担当者、海外地域のトレジャリーチーム、BPO（ビジネスプロセスアウトソーシング）企業だけでなく、幅広い社内部門（経営企画、FP&A、IR、事業開発、R&D、営業などの）との密接な協力を必要とする。さらに、さまざまな外部ステークホルダー（株主、金融機関、格付機関など）との強固な関係を築くことが不可欠となる。
・This position is responsible for corporate finance functions at the headquarters, including integrated analysis and management of P&L, balance sheet and cash flow based on mid- to long-term business plans, formulation of financial strategies, initiatives to achieve optimal capital structure, as well as planning of funding strategies, in order to support the management team.
・In addition, this personnel handles treasury activities, including cash management(Japanese yen and foreign currencies), external funding (commercial paper, bank loan, etc), foreign exchange management (analysis, deals, processing), group finance (intercompany loan, cash pooling, netting settlement, etc), audit-related operations, arrangement of documents and internal meetings related to financial operations, and reporting to related
authorities.
・The role requires close collaboration not only with treasury personnel in Japan, overseas regional treasury teams, and BPO (Business Process Outsourcing) companies, but also with a wide range of internal departments (Corporate Strategy, FP&A, IR, Business Development, R&D, Sales etc.). Furthermore, building strong relationships with various external stakeholders (shareholders, financial institutions, rating agencies, etc.) is essential.
【職務の内容 / Essential Job Responsibilities】
（雇入れ直後）
・中長期的なビジネスプランに沿った財務戦略を策定・実行し、損益計算書（P&L）、貸借対照表、キャッシュフローを統合した分析と管理を行い、最適な資本構成の構築と資金調達要件をサポートする。
・海外地域のトレジャリーチームや金融機関とのコミュニケーション、交渉、協力をし、現在の状況と将来の予測に基づいた資金調達計画を策定・実施する。
・海外地域のトレジャリーチームと協力して効率的な運営と適切なキャッシュフロー管理を実施する。
・社内にて財務に関する知識を共有し、また株主、金融機関、格付機関などの外部ステークホルダーとの強固な関係を築くことで、有利な資金調達条件を確保し、企業としての信頼性を高める。
・戦略的なプロジェクトを積極的にリードすることで、会社の財務機能を変革・強化する新しい取り組みを推進する。
・コーポレートファイナンスおよびトレジャリーに関連するアドホックな業務対応をする。
・Develop and execute financial strategies aligned with mid- to long-term business plans, including integrated analysis and management of P&L, balance sheet, and cash flow to support optimal capital structure and funding requirements.
・Establish and implement a funding plan based on the present situation and forecast in the future, including communication, negotiations and collaboration with regional treasury teams and financial institutions.
・Maintain efficient operation and appropriate cash flow management in collaboration with regional treasury teams.
・Share knowledge on treasury with internal organization and build strong relationships with external stakeholders including shareholders, financial institutions and rating agencies, in order to secure favorable financing conditions and enhance corporate credibility.
・Drive new initiatives to transform and enhance the treasury function at the Company by proactively leading strategic projects.
・Execute of ad hoc items related to corporate finance and treasury.
（変更の範囲）
会社内での全ての業務

This position is based in Nihonbashi and will require on-site work 2-3 times a week, depending on the works in charge.

title: 【東京本社】 (Sr)オンサイトサポートエンジニア【バイリンガル必須】
description_text:
General Information
Job Advert Title:
【東京本社】 (Sr)オンサイトサポートエンジニア【バイリンガル必須】
Location:
Nihonbashi, Tokyo
Division:
DigitalX
Employment Class:
Permanent
Description
【募集の背景 / Purpose & Scope】
シニア・オンサイトサポートエンジニアは、担当拠点におけるITインフラおよびシステムの最適な運用を支えるため、包括的な技術サポートとサービスを提供する役割です。 本ポジションでは、ハードウェアおよびソフトウェアのインストール、保守、トラブルシューティング、修理などを行い、技術的な問題を迅速かつ丁寧に解決することで、優れたカスタマーサービスを提供します。
The Senior On-Site Support Engineer is responsible for providing comprehensive onsite technology support and services to ensure optimal performance of all IT infrastructure and systems at assigned sites. This role involves installation, maintenance, troubleshooting, and repair of hardware and software, as well as providing excellent customer service to resolve technical issues efficiently.
【職務の内容 / Essential Job Responsibilities】
（雇入れ直後）
オンサイトサポート：
•	ハードウェア、ソフトウェア、ネットワークに関する技術的な問題に対し、迅速かつ的確なサポートを提供
•	IT機器・システム（PC、サーバー、OS、ネットワーク等）の定期メンテナンス、Windowsパッチ適用およびアップグレード（※シニアポジション対象）
•	PC、iPad、iPhone、プリンターなどの周辺機器のインストールおよび設定
•	シニアポジションでは、技術的なエスカレーション対応の窓口となる
トラブルシューティングおよび修理：
•	PC、サーバー、ネットワーク等の技術的な問題の診断および解決
•	必要に応じてハードウェアの修理・交換、システムの更新を実施
•	診断ツールやソフトウェアを活用し、障害の特定と対応を行う
カスタマーサービス：
•	顧客の技術的な懸念に対し、迅速かつ丁寧な対応を通じて優れたサービスを提供
•	顧客のニーズを的確に把握し、適切なソリューションを提案
•	エンドユーザーへの技術使用方法やベストプラクティスのトレーニング・サポートを実施
ドキュメンテーションおよび報告：
•	サービス依頼、インシデント報告、保守記録など、オンサイト業務の正確な記録を維持
•	システム構成、手順、トラブル対応方法などを文書化し、将来の参照に備える
•	管理者への定期的なステータス報告を実施
コンプライアンスおよびセキュリティ：
•	社内ポリシー、業界標準、法令等の遵守を徹底
•	クライアントデータおよびITインフラを保護するためのセキュリティプロトコルを実施・管理
継続的な改善：
•	新技術や業界動向を常に把握し、知識をアップデート
•	スキル向上のための研修やプロフェッショナル開発に積極的に参加
•	ベストプラクティスや業務改善の提案・実施に貢献
チームとしての協働：
•	拠点内外のメンバーと連携し、知識共有やプロセス改善を推進
•	ラボサポート、AVサポートなど他のオンサイトチームとの協働
•	インフラ、セキュリティなどのリモートチームと連携し、最適なサービス提供を実現
•	必要に応じて、ネットワーク、サーバー、セキュリティチームの「手と目」として現場対応を行う
Onsite Support:
•	Provide timely and effective technical support for hardware, software, and networking issues.
•	Perform routine maintenance, （For Senior position :）windows patching and upgrades on IT systems and equipment. (Computers, servers, operating systems, networks, and other technology components.)
•	Install and configure computer systems, iPads, iPhones, printers, and other peripherals.
•	For Senior position : Be the point of escalation.
Troubleshooting and Repair:
•	Diagnose and resolve technical issues with computers, servers, networks, and other technology components.
•	Perform hardware repairs, replacements, and system updates as needed.
•	Utilize diagnostic tools and software to identify and address system faults.
Customer Service:
•	Provide exceptional customer service to clients by addressing their technology concerns promptly and professionally.
•	Communicate effectively with clients to understand their needs and provide appropriate solutions.
•	Train and support end-users on technology usage and best practices.
Documentation and Reporting:
•	Maintain accurate records of all onsite activities, including service requests, incident reports, and maintenance logs.
•	Document configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting steps for future reference.
•	Provide regular status updates and reports to management.
Compliance and Security:
•	Ensure compliance with company policies, industry standards, and regulatory requirements.
•	Implement and enforce security protocols to protect client data and IT infrastructure
•	Continuous Improvement:
•	Stay current with emerging technologies and industry trends.
•	Participate in training and professional development opportunities to enhance skills and knowledge.
•	Contribute to the development and implementation of best practices and process improvements.
Work as one team:
•	Work together with counterparts within and between the sites to share knowledge and improve processes
•	Work together with other support teams which are on-site. (e.g Lab support , AV support)
•	Work together with remote teams to provide the best possible service. (e.g Infrastructure , Security)
•	Be the hands and eyes for remote teams when needed. (e.g. Network , Server , Security team)
（変更の範囲）
会社内での全ての業務
【就業環境に関する要件 / Specific Physical or Environmental Requirements】
•	本ポジションは、東京・焼津・富山・つくばのいずれかの拠点を勤務地とし、オンサイトでの勤務が必要となります。
•	This position is based in Tokyo and will require on-site work.
【応募要件 / Qualifications】
＜必須 / Required＞
•	コンピューターサイエンス、情報技術、または関連分野の学士号、もしくは同等の実務経験
•	フィールドサービスまたは類似の技術サポート業務における実務経験3年以上（※シニアポジションは5年以上）
•	シニアポジションの場合：製造業または研究環境での業務経験3年以上
•	コンピューターのハードウェア、ソフトウェア、ネットワーク、OSに関する深い知識
•	IT機器およびシステムのトラブルシューティングおよび修理に関する高いスキル
•	優れたカスタマーサービス対応力およびコミュニケーション能力
•	自律的に業務を遂行でき、複数のタスクを効率的に管理できる能力
•	ビジネスレベルの日本語（読み書き・会話）に堪能であること
•	製薬業界および関連業務プロセスに関する基本的な知識
•	ITサービスマネジメント、サービスデスク、変更管理プロセスに関する経験
•	多文化・多国籍環境での業務経験がある方歓迎
•	ITILおよびアジャイル開発手法に関する知識
•	ServiceNow ITSMに関する知識
•	異なる文化や地域での働き方への理解と柔軟性
•	必要に応じて他拠点への出張が可能な方
•	Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field, or equivalent experience.
•	3+  years, for Senior position 5+years, of experience in a field services or similar technical support role.
•	For Senior position :3+ years of experience in manufacture or research environments
•	Strong knowledge of computer hardware, software, networking, and operating systems.
•	Proficiency in troubleshooting and repair of IT equipment and systems.
•	Excellent customer service and communication skills.
•	Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks effectively.
•	Fluent in written and verbal business Japanese
•	Some knowledge of pharmaceutical business and related business processes
•	Some experience with IT Service Management, Service Desk, and Change Management processes
•	Some work experience across multiple cultures and countries / regions is a plus
•	Knowledge of ITIL and Agile
•	Knowledge of ServiceNow ITSM
•	Appreciation of working cultures and countries / regions
•	Willingness to travel to other sites as required.
＜歓迎 / Preferred＞
•  CompTIA A+、Network+、Microsoft Certified などの関連資格
•  Microsoft製品（Teams、OneDrive、M365、サーバーOS、Azureなど）への理解
•  ITILおよび／またはアジャイル関連の認定資格
• シニアポジションの場合：ServiceNow ITSMに関する高度な知識（例：レポート作成、モニタリングなど）
• ビジネスレベルの英語力（読み書きと会話）
•	Certifications such as CompTIA A+, Network+, or Microsoft Certified .
•	Familiarity with Microsoft products (e.g., Teams, OneDrive, M365, Server Operating systems, Azure).
•	ITIL and/or Agile certifications
•	For Senior position :Advanced knowledge of ServiceNow ITSM (e.g. reporting, monitoring)
•	Fluent in written and verbal business English
【応募書類 / Application Documents】
和文履歴書・和文職務経歴書・英文レジュメ
Both Japanese and English Resumes are needed
【選考プロセス / Selection details】
書類選考 → 1次面接 →  最終面接
※変更の可能性もございますので、予めご了承下さい。
CV screening → First interview →  Final interview
*Please be advised that there might be a change in the process.
【勤務地 / Location】
（雇入れ直後）
東京都中央区　アステラス製薬　日本橋事業所　本社
Nihonbashi, Tokyo
（変更の範囲）
会社の定める事業場および自宅
【勤務開始日 / Start Date】
応相談
Will be decided according to the candidate's flexibility
【契約期間 / Contract Duration】
期間の定めなし
Not limited to specified period
【試用期間 / Probation Period】
試用期間原則なし
No probation period in principle
【給与 / Salary】
①基本給：当人の経歴・技術・技能等を考慮して決定
②裁量労働制の場合：裁量労働手当として職務グレードに応じて50,000～100,000円支給
③フレックスタイム制の場合：月間の所定労働時間を超えて勤務する時間に対して時間外勤務手当を支給
①Base salary: will be decided by the candidate's experience, skill and capability.
②When Discretionary Work System is applied: Discretionary work allowance will be paid.(50,000～100,000yen, based on the Grade)
③When Flextime System is applied: Overtime allowance will be paid for time worked in excess of prescribed working hours.
【昇給 / Salary Raise】
有り
【賞与 / Bonus】
有り
【諸手当 / Allowance】
住宅手当、通勤手当　等
Housing allowance, Commutation allowance, etc.
【勤務時間 / Working Hours】
東京本社事業所
8:45～17:45（月～木）、8:45～16:00（金）、定時制
8:45～17:45（Mon～Thu）、8:45～16:00（Fri）
Fixed-Time Work
【休日 / Holidays】
完全週休２日制（土曜・日曜）、祝日、5月1日、夏季、年末年始
Weekends(Sat and Sun), holidays, May 1st, summer vacation, New Year holidays
【休暇 / Vacation Leave】
年次有給休暇、育児休業制度、介護休業制度　等
Annual paid leave, childcare leave system, nursing care leave system, etc.
【福利厚生 / Welfare】
雇用保険、労災保険、厚生年金、健康保険、共済会制度、社宅制度、持株会制度、財形貯蓄制度　等
Employment Insurance, Industrial Accident Compensation Insurance, Welfare Pension Insurance, Health Insurance, Mutual Aid Association System, Company Housing System, Employee Shareholder Association System, Property Accumulation Savings System

https://re-jp.astellas.com/jp/recruit/newgraduates/
